sentences.en: At times the arrogance of those in power is quite blatant.
sentences.cn: 有时那些当权者颇为傲慢嚣张。

sentences.en: Conceit comes from shallowness; arrogance is due to ignorance.
sentences.cn: 骄傲来自浅薄, 狂妄出于无知.

sentences.en: He has never exhibited the self-confidence, bordering on arrogance, of his predecessor.
sentences.cn: 他从未表现出他前任的那种近乎傲慢的自信。

sentences.en: His arrogance comes out in every speech he makes.
sentences.cn: 他每次讲话都表现得骄傲自大.

sentences.en: His arrogance lowered him in her estimation.
sentences.cn: 他的妄自尊大降低了他在她心目中的位置.

sentences.en: His treatment of his secretary was a blatant example of managerial arrogance.
sentences.cn: 他管理的傲慢作风在他对待秘书的态度上表露无遗.

sentences.en: I can't stand that man and his arrogance.
sentences.cn: 我讨厌那个男人和他的傲慢。

sentences.en: I couldn’t believe the arrogance of the man!
sentences.cn: 我真不敢相信那个男人那么傲慢！

sentences.en: I disliked him for his arrogance.
It is easy to misconstrue confidence as arrogance.
sentences.cn: 很容易将信心误解为傲慢。

sentences.en: The arrogance and selfishness of different interest groups never ceases to amaze me.
sentences.cn: 不同利益集团的傲慢和自私总是会让我大吃一惊。

sentences.en: The arrogance became his protective carapace.
sentences.cn: 这种傲慢态度成了他的保护壳。

sentences.en: Unconscious envy manifests itself very often as this kind of arrogance.
sentences.cn: 潜意识里的嫉妒常表现为这种傲慢自大。

trans.tran_en: when someone behaves in a rude way because they think they are very important
